Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:5.0a2) Gecko/20110511 Thunderbird/3.3a4pre

1. Sometimes you have to use address book to find the correspondent when creating new message to paste it into "to", "cc" & etc. field. Of course you can begin entering his name or e-mail in these fields, but nevertheless... The bug is that after opening address book and selecting the necessary recipient by pressing "write" his e-mail pastes in the new "write" window instead of the already opened one.
2. Double-clicking on the contact in address book opens contact's properties but obviously should trigger the "write" command and paste the address into "to" field.
3. Double-clicking on the "to", "cc" & etc. field could open address book and return the chosen email in itself after selecting. 

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. click "create a new message"
2. open tools-address book in the appeared window
3. choose any contact in address book
4. click write

Actual Results:  
new "write" window message opens with selected email pasted

Expected Results:  
selected email should be pasted in the already opened "write" window
